edu.first.robot

Class SimpleRobot

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.first.robot.SimpleRobot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RobotMode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleRobotAdapter

    public abstract class SimpleRobot
extends java.lang.Object
implements RobotMode
    Main class representing a "Simple" style robot mode. This is basically the equivalent to edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SimpleRobot, but as a RobotMode. The basic framework is that each mode has its own method, which is called once every time the mode starts.
    Since:
    May 08 13

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleRobot

        public SimpleRobot(java.lang.String name)
        Constructs the robot mode using the name to show the user. The name should be recognizable, like "Defensive Mode" or "Single Driver Mode".
        Parameters:
        name - easily understandable phrase to refer to the mode as

      • periodicAutonomous

        public final void periodicAutonomous()
        Deprecated. not used in SimpleRobot
        Description copied from interface: RobotMode
        Runs periodically during the autonomous period. The standard for periodic is 50Hz, or 20ms. This standard is not guaranteed.
        Specified by:
